algebraic_word_problem: A train departs at 9 AM and travels at 80 km/h. A second train leaves the same station at 11 AM and travels at 100 km/h in the same direction. At what time will the second train catch up with the first?
step_by_step_solution: Distance first train travels = 80 * 2 = 160 km; Relative speed = 100 - 80 = 20 km/h; Time to catch up = 160 / 20 = 8 hours; 9 AM + 8 hours = 3 PM.
